snippet: Richard Grenell, a foreign policy spokesman for Mitt Romney, resigned on Tuesday after an unexpectedly messy and public dispute over his role and reputation.
abstract: Aides to Mitt Romney insist they did everything to keep Richard Grenell, gay political strategist, from resigning; on one level, his short-lived and rocky tenure with the campaign is the story of halting attempts to manage Romney's relationship with the conservative wing of the party; on another level, it is also about how a fast-growing campaign, operating under the sharp glare of a general election, failed to spot potential hazards of a high-profile appointment.

byline.original: By MICHAEL BARBARO, HELENE COOPER and ASHLEY PARKER
byline.contributor: Jeff Zeleny and Richard A. Oppel Jr. contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Richard Grenell, a foreign policy spokesman for Mitt Romney, resigned on Tuesday after an unexpectedly messy and public dispute over his role and reputation.

headline.seo: Behind Richard Grenell’s Departure, a Right-Wing Storm
headline.main: Romney Camp Stirred Storm Over Gay Aide
headline.print_headline: Romney Camp Stirred Storm Over Gay Aide
